intro: Nepeta troitzkyi, commonly known as the Siberian catmint, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features square, hairy stems and opposite leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers in whorled clusters, which bloom in late summer. It is often used in traditional medicine and has a mild minty scent. Nepeta troitzkyi is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils.
